content.question: Which of the following best explains the motivation of the group protesting in image 1 ?

choices.label: Fear of communist subversion caused Western European governments to crack down on labor unions.
Working- and middle-class Western Europeans increasingly relied on government pension and health-care benefits.
A growing segment of Western European society rejected the cradle-to-grave model of the welfare state and called for free-market reforms.
Students and other critics of middle-class social values increasingly took to the streets to protest, as in the student rebellions of 1968.

content.answer: Working- and middle-class Western Europeans increasingly relied on government pension and health-care benefits.
